intro: Douglasia alaskana, commonly known as the Alaska douglasia, is a perennial herb native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and flowering plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as tundra and alpine meadows. It features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and covered in a dense layer of fine, woolly hairs.
